questions.text: A young male, aged 24, has presented with asymptomatic scaly skin lesions on his back, symmetrically distributed. The provided images showcase the lesions. Can you identify the pattern of these skin lesions & the specific disease? (INICET NOV 2023)

options.label: A
options.text: Collarette scale - Christmas tree pattern - Pityriasis rosea

questions.correct_answer: A. Collarette scale - Christmas tree pattern - Pityriasis rosea

Ans.

  • • Option C. Christmas Tree Pattern - Lichen Planus:

  • • The Woronoff ring is a hypopigmented ring surrounding individual psoriatic lesions . It is usually associated with treatment, most commonly UV radiation or topical steroids .

questions.text: Which of the following laboratory test is used to diagnose rotavirus diarrhea? (NEET PG 2023)

options.label: A
options.text: Antigen detection in the stool sample

questions.correct_answer: A. Antigen detection in the stool sample
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Antigen detection in the stool sample

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Antigen detection in stool samples is the standard diagnostic approach for confirming rotavirus infection, crucial for implementing appropriate management strategies, especially in managing dehydration risks in young children.

questions.text: 52-year-old man collapses and you are giving CPR with your friend. What is the ratio of chest compressions to rescue breaths? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 30:2

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In adult CPR, the ratio of chest compressions to rescue breaths is always 30:2, regardless of the number of rescuers.

questions.text: Which of the following is an absolute contraindication for the insertion of the device shown in the image below? (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Trophoblastic disease

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The given image shows a copper-containing IUCD (intrauterine contraceptive device). ABSOLUTE c/I to an Intra-uterine device are: Unexplained uterine or vaginal bleeding Post abortal sepsis/ Puerperal sepsis/ Current Pelvic inflammatory/ disease, Genital Tuberculosis Cancers: Endometrial cancer, Cervical cancer, Gestational trophoblastic neoplasia Large fibroid distorting the uterine cavity, Mullerian anomalies distorting the uterine cavity
  • • The given image shows a copper-containing IUCD (intrauterine contraceptive device).
  • • ABSOLUTE c/I to an Intra-uterine device are: Unexplained uterine or vaginal bleeding Post abortal sepsis/ Puerperal sepsis/ Current Pelvic inflammatory/ disease, Genital Tuberculosis Cancers: Endometrial cancer, Cervical cancer, Gestational trophoblastic neoplasia Large fibroid distorting the uterine cavity, Mullerian anomalies distorting the uterine cavity
  • • Unexplained uterine or vaginal bleeding Post abortal sepsis/ Puerperal sepsis/ Current Pelvic inflammatory/ disease, Genital Tuberculosis Cancers: Endometrial cancer, Cervical cancer, Gestational trophoblastic neoplasia Large fibroid distorting the uterine cavity, Mullerian anomalies distorting the uterine cavity
  • • Unexplained uterine or vaginal bleeding
  • • Post abortal sepsis/ Puerperal sepsis/ Current Pelvic inflammatory/ disease, Genital Tuberculosis
  • • Cancers: Endometrial cancer, Cervical cancer, Gestational trophoblastic neoplasia
  • • Large fibroid distorting the uterine cavity, Mullerian anomalies distorting the uterine cavity
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Menstruation : Intra-uterine device can be inserted even during periods although preferably it should be inserted post-menstrual
  • • Option A. Menstruation
  • • Option C. Immediately after delivery : This is called as Post placental IUCD insertion (within 10 mins of placental delivery)
  • • Option C. Immediately after delivery
  • • Option D. Ruptured condom during intercourse : Following a ruptured condom, CUT can be inserted as an emergency contraception
  • • Option D. Ruptured condom during intercourse

questions.text: A 16-year-old male patient is diagnosed with osteosarcoma and is scheduled to undergo chemotherapy as part of his treatment. Methotrexate is included in his chemotherapy regimen. What is the mechanism of action of methotrexate in the treatment of his osteosarcoma? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Competitive inhibitor of DHFR.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Methotrexate's primary mechanism of action in treating osteosarcoma is as a competitive inhibitor of dihydrofolate reductase (DHFR), which interferes with DNA synthesis and cell division in rapidly dividing cells.

questions.text: A 65-year-old patient is admitted to the hospital with septic shock. The physician decides to administer vasopressors to manage the patient's condition. The patient also requires multiple infusions that are not compatible with peripheral intravenous access. A central venous catheter is inserted into the patient's internal jugular vein. Which of the following statements are true regarding central and peripheral venous access and their associated complications? (INICET NOV 2022) Phlebitis is the most common complication associated with peripheral venous access. Flushing with isotonic saline and heparin can maintain patency in both central and peripheral venous catheters. If an arteriovenous fistula is present in a limb, peripheral venous access should be avoided in that same limb. Vasopressors used for septic shock are typically administered via a central venous catheter to avoid limb ischemia.
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 1, 2, 3, 4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Septic shock is a life-threatening medical condition that occurs as a result of a severe infection leading to a systemic inflammatory response. It is characterized by a combination of infection, low blood pressure (hypotension), and organ dysfunction. Here are some key points about septic shock:
  • ➤ Infection : Septic shock typically begins with an infection, often caused by bacteria, but it can also result from fungal or viral infections. Common sources of infection include lung infections (pneumonia), urinary tract infections, abdominal infections, and skin infections. Systemic Inflammatory Response : In response to the infection, the body's immune system initiates a widespread inflammatory response. This response can become dysregulated, leading to an exaggerated release of inflammatory molecules (cytokines) into the bloodstream. Hypotension : One of the hallmark features of septic shock is low blood pressure (hypotension). The inflammation and vasodilation caused by the infection can lead to a drop in blood pressure, which can result in inadequate blood flow to vital organs. Organ Dysfunction : As blood pressure drops and organs receive less oxygen and nutrients, multiple organ systems can begin to fail. This can lead to dysfunction in the heart, lungs, kidneys, liver, and other organs. Organ dysfunction is a critical component of septic shock and contributes to its high mortality rate. Symptoms : Symptoms of septic shock can include fever or hypothermia (low body temperature), rapid heart rate, rapid breathing, confusion, altered mental status, and signs of organ dysfunction such as respiratory distress, kidney failure, or liver dysfunction. Treatment : The treatment of septic shock is a medical emergency and involves aggressive interventions. It typically includes antibiotics to treat the underlying infection, intravenous fluids to maintain blood pressure, vasopressor medications to constrict blood vessels and raise blood pressure, and supportive care in an intensive care unit (ICU).
  • ➤ Infection : Septic shock typically begins with an infection, often caused by bacteria, but it can also result from fungal or viral infections. Common sources of infection include lung infections (pneumonia), urinary tract infections, abdominal infections, and skin infections.
  • ➤ Infection
  • ➤ Systemic Inflammatory Response : In response to the infection, the body's immune system initiates a widespread inflammatory response. This response can become dysregulated, leading to an exaggerated release of inflammatory molecules (cytokines) into the bloodstream.
  • ➤ Systemic Inflammatory Response
  • ➤ Hypotension : One of the hallmark features of septic shock is low blood pressure (hypotension). The inflammation and vasodilation caused by the infection can lead to a drop in blood pressure, which can result in inadequate blood flow to vital organs.
  • ➤ Hypotension
  • ➤ Organ Dysfunction : As blood pressure drops and organs receive less oxygen and nutrients, multiple organ systems can begin to fail. This can lead to dysfunction in the heart, lungs, kidneys, liver, and other organs. Organ dysfunction is a critical component of septic shock and contributes to its high mortality rate.
  • ➤ Organ Dysfunction
  • ➤ Symptoms : Symptoms of septic shock can include fever or hypothermia (low body temperature), rapid heart rate, rapid breathing, confusion, altered mental status, and signs of organ dysfunction such as respiratory distress, kidney failure, or liver dysfunction.
  • ➤ Symptoms
  • ➤ Treatment : The treatment of septic shock is a medical emergency and involves aggressive interventions. It typically includes antibiotics to treat the underlying infection, intravenous fluids to maintain blood pressure, vasopressor medications to constrict blood vessels and raise blood pressure, and supportive care in an intensive care unit (ICU).
  • ➤ Treatment

questions.text: Diagnose the following radiograph. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Arnold Chiari malformation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Arnold Chiari malformation is identified by the herniation of the cerebellar tonsils through the foramen magnum, visible on MRI scans as the downward displacement of cerebellar tissue.

questions.text: The marked line corresponds to which vertebral level? ( FMGE JAN 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. L3

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The image shows a diagram with a line indicating the subcostal plane, which corresponds to a specific vertebral level. The subcostal plane is an important anatomical landmark and is used to divide the abdomen into regions for clinical and surgical purposes.
  • • Subcostal Plane: The subcostal plane passes through the lowest point of the costal margin, which is generally at the level of the third lumbar vertebra (L3). Anatomical Landmarks: The subcostal plane is a horizontal plane that typically lies just below the rib cage. It is an important reference point for dividing the abdomen into regions. The umbilicus, lies at the level of the L3-L4 junction, but the subcostal plane is typically slightly superior to this and corresponds to L3.
  • • Subcostal Plane: The subcostal plane passes through the lowest point of the costal margin, which is generally at the level of the third lumbar vertebra (L3).
  • • Anatomical Landmarks: The subcostal plane is a horizontal plane that typically lies just below the rib cage. It is an important reference point for dividing the abdomen into regions. The umbilicus, lies at the level of the L3-L4 junction, but the subcostal plane is typically slightly superior to this and corresponds to L3.
  • • The subcostal plane is a horizontal plane that typically lies just below the rib cage. It is an important reference point for dividing the abdomen into regions. The umbilicus, lies at the level of the L3-L4 junction, but the subcostal plane is typically slightly superior to this and corresponds to L3.
  • • The subcostal plane is a horizontal plane that typically lies just below the rib cage.
  • • It is an important reference point for dividing the abdomen into regions.
  • • The umbilicus, lies at the level of the L3-L4 junction, but the subcostal plane is typically slightly superior to this and corresponds to L3.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. T12: This is incorrect. T12 is located higher up in the thoracic region.
  • • Option A. T12:
  • • Option B. L1: This is incorrect. The transpyloric plane, passes through the level of L1.
  • • Option B. L1:
  • • Option C. L2 : This is incorrect. L2 is also superior to the subcostal plane.
  • • Option C. L2

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The subcostal plane is an important anatomical landmark that typically corresponds to the level of the third lumbar vertebra (L3), helping to divide the abdomen into regions for clinical and surgical reference.

questions.text: A woman gave birth to twins belonging to two different fathers. This case would be best described as? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Superfecundation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ :
  • ➤ Superfecundation refers to the fertilization of two ova from separate acts of coitus within the same menstrual cycle, resulting in the birth of twins that can have different fathers and are born at the same time.

questions.text: Which of the following antidepressants causes the least sexual dysfunction? (INICET NOV 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. Mirtazapine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Mirtazapine is an atypical antidepressant. Apart from increasing the levels of serotonin and nor-adrenaline (due to blockade of presynaptic alpha 2 receptors), It also acts as an antagonist of serotonin (5-HT2 and 5-HT3) receptors. It has some degree of H1 blocking property also. It is therefore known as NSSA (Nor adrenergic and Specific Serotonergic Antidepressant). Mirtazapine is generally associated with a lower incidence of sexual side effects compared to SSRIs and SNRIs, making it a better option for patients concerned about these issues.
  • ➤ Mirtazapine

questions.text: A 6-year-old boy came with bilateral cervical lymphadenopathy. What is the probable diagnosis, cell, and virus associated with the image given below? ( AIIMS NOV 2021) ( RS cell: Reed - Sternberg cell, HIV: Human immunodeficiency virus, CMV: Cytomegalovirus, EBV: Epstein-Barr virus )
questions.correct_answer: C. Hodgkin's lymphoma, RS cell, EBV

Ans. C) Hodgkin's lymphoma, RS cell, EBV

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hodgkin's lymphoma is characterized by the presence of Reed-Sternberg (RS) cells , and it is often associated with Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) , particularly in specific subtypes.
  • ➤ Hodgkin's lymphoma
  • ➤ Reed-Sternberg (RS) cells
  • ➤ Epstein-Barr virus (EBV)

questions.text: 65-year-old lady with a history of COPD and cor pulmonale presents with breathlessness and frequent exacerbations. Which of the following will improve survival in this patient? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Long-term O2 therapy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Long-term oxygen therapy (LTOT) is one of the few interventions that improve survival in patients with COPD, especially those with severe hypoxemia and complications like cor pulmonale.

questions.text: Elective splenectomy is preferred in which of the following conditions? (FMGE JAN 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Hereditary spherocytosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Elective splenectomy is indicated in hereditary spherocytosis to decrease hemolysis and improve symptoms, particularly in patients with severe anemia or those who require frequent blood transfusions.

questions.text: A 60-year-old man with a known history of diabetes mellitus presents with a BP of 150/90 and dizziness. What is the best way to manage this patient? ( INICET Nov 2023)
questions.correct_answer: D. Diet, Exercise, Lifestyle modification + Amlodipine
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Diet, Exercise, Lifestyle modification + Amlodipine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For hypertensive diabetic patients, it is essential to start pharmacological therapy along with lifestyle modifications to reduce cardiovascular risk. Amlodipine is an appropriate choice for initial therapy in this context.

questions.text: A 45-year-old patient with a history of depression was started on amitriptyline, a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA). The patient was later found unconscious at home and brought to the emergency department. On examination, the patient shows signs of arrhythmias, confusion, and pupillary dilation. Which of the following does NOT suggest TCA poisoning?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Hypothermia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hypothermia is not a typical feature of tricyclic antidepressant (TCA) poisoning, whereas arrhythmias, confusion, and pupillary dilation are common clinical manifestations.

questions.text: Chlorpromazine is an antipsychotic drug. It also produces sedation and adverse effects like dry mouth and hypotension. All these actions result due to action on which of the following receptors?(INICET MAY 2024) 1. D2 and 5HT2 receptors 2. GABA and Beta-adrenergic receptors 3. Muscarinic and alpha-adrenergic receptors 4. H1 receptors
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. 1, 3 and 4 are correct

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Actions of anti-psychotic drugs

questions.text: 40-year-old male was started on tuberculosis treatment after which he started complaining of visual disturbances. Which drug is likely to cause this side effect? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Ethambutol

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ethambutol is the antituberculosis drug most commonly associated with visual disturbances, particularly optic neuritis.

questions.text: What is the likely diagnosis based on the X-ray? (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Patella fracture

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A patella fracture can be identified on an X-ray by a distinct fracture line through the patella, differentiating it from other conditions like hemarthrosis, bipartite patella, and ligament injuries.

questions.text: Match the correct antidote with the given drug toxicity: (INICET NOV 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Benzodiazepine: Flumazenil

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Flumazenil is the specific antidote for benzodiazepine toxicity. Mechanism - it acts as a competitive antagonist at the benzodiazepine receptor site on the GABA-A receptor complex. By competitively blocking these receptors, it can rapidly reverse benzodiazepine-induced sedation and respiratory depression.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Atropine: L-carnitine : Incorrect. Physostigmine is the antidote for atropine poisoning as it can reverse both peripheral and central anticholinergic effects. L-carnitine is used specifically for valproate-induced hepatotoxicity.
  • • Option A. Atropine:
  • • L-carnitine
  • • Option B. Barbiturate: Fomepizole : Incorrect. Barbiturates do not have a specific antidote - management involves alkalinization of urine to enhance excretion. Fomepizole is the antidote for methanol and ethylene glycol poisoning as it inhibits alcohol dehydrogenase.
  • • Option B. Barbiturate:
  • • Fomepizole
  • • Option C. Arsenic: Desferrioxamine : Incorrect. British Anti-Lewisite (BAL/Dimercaprol) is the antidote for arsenic poisoning. Desferrioxamine is specifically used for iron poisoning (both acute poisoning and chronic overload).
  • • Option C. Arsenic:
  • • Desferrioxamine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Antidotes
  • ➤ Antidotes

questions.text: A patient came following an RTA in the hospital. He is able to understand his friend’s talks. He is trying to speak (non-fluent aphasia) something to his friend. Which part of the brain is most likely to be injured? (FMGE JANUARY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.  C) Broca’s area

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Broca’s area is responsible for speech production and language processing. It is located in the frontal lobe of the dominant hemisphere (usually the left hemisphere) of the brain. Injury to Broca’s area leads to Broca’s aphasia, also known as non-fluent aphasia. Individuals with this condition can understand spoken language but have difficulty in speaking, writing, or forming words properly.
  • • Broca’s area : Broca’s aphasia is characterized by difficulty in speech production. The patient may understand speech but will struggle to speak fluently, often speaking in short, broken sentences with considerable effort. This condition is also known as expressive aphasia.
  • • Broca’s area
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Wernicke’s area : This area is involved in the comprehension of spoken language. Damage to Wernicke’s area results in Wernicke’s aphasia (fluent aphasia), where the patient can speak fluently but the speech is often nonsensical and lacks meaning.
  • • Option A. Wernicke’s area
  • • Option B. Angular gyrus : This region is involved in various functions related to language, number processing, and spatial cognition but is not directly responsible for speech production or comprehension.
  • • Option B. Angular gyrus
  • • Option D. Arcuate fasciculus : This is a bundle of nerve fibers that connects Broca’s area and Wernicke’s area. Damage to this pathway can result in conduction aphasia, characterized by the ability to understand and produce speech but difficulty in repeating words or sentences.
  • • Option D. Arcuate fasciculus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Broca’s area is involved in speech production. Damage to this area results in non-fluent (expressive) aphasia, where the patient can understand speech but has difficulty speaking fluently.

questions.text: Cannabinoids are approved in all of the following except: (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cannabinoids, such as Epidiolex, are approved for the treatment of Dravet Syndrome, Lennox-Gastaut Syndrome, and Tuberous Sclerosis, but not for Rett Syndrome.
  • ➤ Note - High-dose Epidiolex is an FDA-approved oil formulation of CBD for use as an add-on treatment for Dravet's and Lennox-Gastaut syndromes and tuberous sclerosis epilepsies. There is clinical evidence for CBD, at lower doses, as an anxiolytic for the treatment of posttraumatic stress, anxiety, and relapse of substance use disorders. Animal studies suggest that this effect of CBD may be mediated by the 5-hydroxytryptamine 1A receptor.
  • ➤ Note -

questions.text: A 32-year-old patient with a history of chronic alcohol abuse presents to the clinic with complaints of oral ulcers and a burning sensation in the mouth. A picture of the patient's oral cavity is provided, which reveals several white patches on the tongue and inner cheek. Based on this presentation, what is the likely diagnosis for this patient? (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Leukoplakia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Leukoplakia is an oral mucosal lesion characterized by white patches that cannot be scraped off and is commonly associated with tobacco and alcohol use. It has the potential for malignant transformation, necessitating regular monitoring and biopsy of suspicious areas.
  • ➤ Leukoplakia is an oral mucosal lesion characterized by white patches that cannot be scraped off and is commonly associated with tobacco and alcohol use.
  • ➤ It has the potential for malignant transformation, necessitating regular monitoring and biopsy of suspicious areas.

questions.text: An individual is in an environment of a temperature of 47°C. What is the mechanism of heat loss? ( INICET Nov 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Sweating

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ At high environmental temperatures, the body relies primarily on sweating and evaporation to lose heat and regulate body temperature effectively.

questions.text: You are a researcher aiming to compile and analyze data from various independent studies to enhance the precision of treatment effect estimates for a specific medical condition. Which of the following methodologies is most appropriate for achieving this objective? (INICET NOV 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Meta-analysis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Meta-analysis is the most effective quantitative approach for synthesizing data from multiple research studies to derive a more precise estimate of the treatment effect. Preference of epidemiological studies for establishing causality - 1st preference is - Meta-analysis
  • ➤ Meta-analysis is the most effective quantitative approach for synthesizing data from multiple research studies to derive a more precise estimate of the treatment effect.
  • ➤ Preference of epidemiological studies for establishing causality - 1st preference is - Meta-analysis

questions.text: A 26-year-old male presented with colicky pain. Following type of crystals were found on urine examination. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hexagonal cystine crystals in urine are characteristic of cystinuria, a genetic disorder affecting the renal absorption of certain amino acids, leading to recurrent cystine stone formation.

questions.text: A 17-year-old girl was brought by her mother to the outpatient department with primary amenorrhea. She had normal breast development and pubic hair. On examination, the vagina was blind-ending and the uterus was not palpable. What is the most probable diagnosis? (INICET MAY 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Mullerian agenesis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Mullerian agenesis is characterized by the absence of the uterus and the upper part of the vagina, with normal ovarian function leading to normal breast and pubic hair development.
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 450, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology 6 th edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 450, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology 6 th edition

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman presents with heavy menstrual bleeding and something coming out of the vagina. Her last childbirth was 10 years back. On bimanual palpation, the uterus is palpable. On examination, the cervix admits 1 finger, and the following is seen. What is the probable diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Fibroid polyp

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A fibroid polyp presents with heavy menstrual bleeding, a palpable uterus on bimanual examination, and a protruding mass in the vagina due to the fibroid extending through the cervix

questions.text: A patient presents in OPD with a history of fever and cough for 5 days. On auscultation, crepts were heard on right side. Chest X-ray is given below. Mark the correct finding in this case? (NEET PG 2023)

options.label: A
options.text: Apical segment of Right lower lobe consolidation

options.label: C
options.text: Posterior segment of right lower lobe consolidation

questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Right middle lobe consolidation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Right middle lobe consolidation is suggested by the obscuration of the right heart border and the specific location of opacity on the chest X-ray, aligned with the patient's clinical presentation of respiratory symptoms. This finding is crucial for diagnosing the specific location of pneumonia, guiding appropriate treatment.

questions.text: Which among the following is a tensor of vocal cord? (NEET PG 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Cricothyroid

questions.text: Which of these statements is true for Adipocere change after death? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: D
options.text: Occurs due to saponification of fats

questions.correct_answer: D. Occurs due to saponification of fats
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Occurs due to saponification of fats

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Adipocere formation after death occurs due to the saponification of fats through an enzymatic process, primarily under warm, moist, and anaerobic conditions.

questions.text: A patient presented with fever, dyspnea, palpitations, and tachycardia. The echocardiography revealed vegetation in the septal leaflets. Tissue sections from them reveal the following findings as shown in the image. What is the most likely implicated agent? (INICET NOV 2021)

options.label: A
options.text: Pigmented septate hyphae at 90 degrees, Mucormycosis

options.label: B
options.text: Right angle branching septate hyphae, Fusarium

options.label: D
options.text: Acute angle branching septate hyphae, Aspergillus

questions.correct_answer: D. Acute angle branching septate hyphae, Aspergillus
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Acute angle branching septate hyphae, Aspergillus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Aspergillus: Typically seen as septate hyphae with acute angle branching on histological stains such as GMS. Mucor and Rhizopus: Non-septate, broad hyphae with right angle branching, distinguishing them from Aspergillus. Fusarium: Requires culture for definitive identification, although morphologically similar to Aspergillus.
  • ➤ Aspergillus: Typically seen as septate hyphae with acute angle branching on histological stains such as GMS.
  • ➤ Aspergillus:
  • ➤ Mucor and Rhizopus: Non-septate, broad hyphae with right angle branching, distinguishing them from Aspergillus.
  • ➤ Mucor and Rhizopus:
  • ➤ Fusarium: Requires culture for definitive identification, although morphologically similar to Aspergillus.
  • ➤ Fusarium:

questions.text: Which of the following is a good prognostic factor for breast cancer patients? (NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) ER+

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ ER-positive status in breast cancer is a good prognostic factor because it indicates a slower-growing tumor that is likely to respond well to hormone therapy.

questions.text: A patient after RTA (Road Traffic Accident) presented with hypovolemic shock. What is the reason for decreased cardiac output in this patient? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Decreased preload

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In hypovolemic shock, the primary cause of decreased cardiac output is decreased preload due to significant loss of blood volume.

questions.text: Death sentence can be given by: (FMGE JANUARY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) A. Session court judge and B. Additional session court

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • In the Indian judicial system, both the Session Court and the Additional Session Court have the authority to pass a death sentence. However, any death sentence given by these courts must be confirmed by the High Court before it can be carried out. The Supreme Court and High Court can also issue death sentences directly.
  • • It is important to note that the Assistant Sessions Court Judge and the Additional Sessions Court Judge are not the same. An Assistant Sessions Court Judge is a junior position and does not have the power to issue a death sentence.
  • • Other Option:
  • • Other Option:
  • • Option. C. Chief judicial magistrate: The Chief Judicial Magistrate does not have the authority to pass a death sentence.
  • • Option. C. Chief judicial magistrate:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ In India, death sentences can be issued by the Session Court, Additional Session Court, High Court, and Supreme Court. However, any death sentence passed by the Session Court or Additional Session Court must be confirmed by the High Court before it can be executed.
